trends: There have been no other sightings in Kilmarnock
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Appeared as a star atop a star moving in erratic directions.
divs: sighting detailsthis is an event that we (wife and i) have seen repeatedly over several years. we have wondered for some years what this could be. the object appears as a star or bright planet. the configuration seems as if it is an hour glass shape. at times it appears to have red or green light on the top or bottom. as we just witnessed the object moved in all directions with no pattern in the movement. in mentioning the red and\or green lights, for a lack of a better description, which are on the top and\or bottom of the hour glass shaped object, it makes one suspect some sort of airplane or helicopter. maybe not. we have seen this object in all seasons, not in the same position in the sky, but there none the less. being located in middle of the east coast and surrounded by numerous military bases could be part of the answer. **tonight we were sitting outside on the patio when i noticed the object(again). we remarked that "there goes the "bouncing star". we watched it for 15 or 20 minutes and then went inside since it is nothing new to us.we first noticed it some years ago late one night on our way home. the road is positioned exactly east west. it was in december, say 2003 or so and the object was directly west. subsequently it has been seen in warm months in the east or east southeast. being courious i decided to research it online and got only one return on a search for moving star and only one reference which lead me here. since it is summer i'll try to find the right optical equipment to record this event and update this entry in the future.
